is a small township in the

located between St. Helena and Oakville, along Hwy 29. This area of the valley was originally owned by General Vallejo and through a series of gifts became the property of Thomas and Elizabeth Rutherford as a wedding present 1964. The Rutherfords developed a winery, which grew to be one of the best wineries of the area. Now the town is home to high quality wineries and restaurants, a beautiful location to enjoy the wine country.

A car is recommended for getting between the various town in Napa Valley. Please do not drink and drive or wine taste and drive.

value: content=Organic vineyard and garden, offering vineyard tours and wine tasting in their Red Barn. In order to tour or taste call in advanced and make a reservation, during the high season call well in advanced.
content=Swanson Vineyards offers wine tasting by appointment only, but it is well worth making that appointment. Cirgue Tasting is $20 and their one hour Harvey Tasting is $55
content=This century old winery is know for its Cabernet which the founding winemaker said required the Rutherford dust to grow. Wine tasting $10, Reserve Tasting $25.
content=Wine tasting: $10, Winery tour and VIP room tasting $15.
content=Fly high above the wine country in a hot air-balloon. For a romantic adventure or a group delight.
content= Daily 10AM-5PM. Gourmet oils, ingredients, wine accessories, and bath and beauty products.
content= Known for its BBQ ribs and cornbread.
content=Serving Breakfast, lunch, dinner daily. An classic Californian cuisine menu with a prix fixe menu and two tasting menus; meat and veterinarian parings with wine. Expensive
content= Make reservations well in advance. For weekends at least 6 weeks ahead. $49 - 88 prix fixe.

If you are looking for a bar or club head towards St. Helena.

value: content=Elegant and luxurious doesn't even begin to describe Auberge De Soleil. Offers "private maisons" rooms, beautiful view and romance.
content=A Californio (Spanish/California in the early and mid 1800's) style rancho, makes you feel as though you are staying in General Vallejo's home. Top notch and expensive.
